lead_paragraph: RASHBAUM--Lynn P.,died at her home in Riverdale, NY on April 27, surrounded by her family. She was 91 years old. Lynn worked as a psychotherapist and social worker in Manhattan for roughly two decades. She grew up in Birmingham, AL, and moved to New York City after studying opera and classical music at Bennington College. In 1956, she married Dr. William K. Rashbaum, with whom she had two children. They divorced in 1972; he died in 2005. A courteous graceful woman with an easy smile, her keen intelligence, curiosity and desire to help others led her to three masters degrees, in teaching, psychology and social work. She is survived by her daughter, Sara Lyn Phillips, her granddaughter, Isabel K. Phillips, her son, William K. Rashbaum Jr., and his wife, Christian L. Wright. A Memorial Service will be May 22 at 3:45pm at the Fourth Universalist Society at 160 Central Park West in Manhattan. 1/3
